intro: Lightfootia huttonii, commonly known as the Hutton's lightfoot, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its botanical features include stellate hairs on the stems and leaves, which contribute to its unique appearance. Lightfootia huttonii is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or savanna habitats.
